item.title: Junction between Torbay Road and Clarence Road, 26th December
item.description:
The speed hump between Torbay Road and Clarence Road is too steep - my car’s floor constantly scrapes against the speed humps and I often hear other cars scraping against it as well, causing underfloor damage. A similar issue was fixed on the junction between Plympton Avenue and Torbay Road by making the humps less steep (adding a more shallow entry and exit), but this was never rectified for the junction between Clarence Road and Torbay Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Torbay Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 32 Torbay Road, 26th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Torbay Road, London

item.title: Gutters leaves, 26th December
item.description:
I’ve called twice and reported numerous times. The leaves were not cleared until 2 weeks ago. They left them in the gutters and drains. Every other road has been cleared, once again this end of Roding Road has been left.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roding Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spilt bin rubbish, 26th December
item.description:
The blue bin was over and rubbish all over pavement.Blue bin was picked up but pile of rubbish left with light stuff left to blow all over street.This pavement had just been cleaned after many months and was looking very good.There is continuing problem with people dumping household waste which makes it very difficult when I walk my very frail husband.I wish council would put cameras up then people might think twice about dumping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lichfield Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
